TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Ustic Palecryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Dunckley loam - brushy rangeland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted.)
01--3 to 1 inch; undecomposed leaves and twigs.
02--1 to 0 inch; decomposed leaves and twigs.
A11--0 to 4 inches; dark brown (10YR 3/3) loam, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; weak fine granular structure; soft, very friable; slightly sticky and nonplastic; many very fine and fine roots and few medium roots; neutral; clear smooth boundary.  (3 to 7 inches thick)
A12--4 to 10 inches; dark brown (10YR 4/3) loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine granular; soft, very friable; slightly sticky and nonplastic; many fine and medium roots and few medium roots; 10 percent pebbles; neutral; clear smooth boundary.  (5 to 9 inches thick)
A2--10 to 19 inches; very pale brown (10YR 7/3) very gravelly loam, light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine granular; soft, very friable; slightly sticky and nonplastic; common fine and few medium roots; 30 percent pebbles, 15 percent cobbles, 5 percent stones; neutral; gradual smooth boundary.  (8 to 10 inches thick)
A&B--19 to 29 inches; mixed (A2) 60 percent very pale brown (10YR 7/3) very gravelly loam, light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine granular; soft, very friable; slightly sticky and nonplastic; (B2) 40 percent yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) very gravelly clay loam, yellowish brown (10YR 5/6 moist; weak fine and moderate subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; few medium roots; 25 percent pebbles, 10 percent cobble, 5 percent stone; neutral; diffuse smooth boundary.  (0 to 10 inches thick)
B&A--29 to 39 inches; mixed (B2) 80 percent yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) very gravelly clay loam, light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) moist; moderate medium and weak fine subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, friable, sticky and plastic; (A2) 20 percent very pale brown (10YR 7/3) very gravelly loam, light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) moist; weak medium subangular blocky structure; soft, very friable, slightly sticky and nonplastic; few medium roots; 30 percent pebbles, 15 percent cobbles, 5 percent stones, neutral, gradual irregular boundary.  (8 to 11 inches thick)
B2t--39 to 60 inches; yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) very cobbly clay loam; yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure parting to weak fine subangular block; slightly hard, very friable, sticky and plastic; few medium roots; continuous moderately thick clay films on faces of peds; 35 percent pebbles, 20 percent cobbles, 5 percent stones; neutral; clear smooth boundary.  (20 to 30 inches thick)
B3--60 to 70 inches; brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) extremely stony loam; yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) moist; moderate medium subangular blocky structure parting to moderate fine subangular blocky; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky and plastic; many moderately thick clay films on faces of peds; 10 percent pebbles, 10 percent cobbles, 50 percent stones, neutral.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Routt County, Colorado; about 9 miles southeast of Hayden, 1,200 feet north and 800 feet east of the SW corner of Sec. 16, T. 5 N., R. 87 W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The mean annual soil temperature is 39 to 42 degrees F.  The mean summer soil temperature is 54 to 56 degrees F.  Content of rock fragments in the particle-size control section range from 35 to 65 percent by volume.  Depth to top of the argillic horizon ranges from 24 to 40 inches.  Clay content of the argillic horizon ranges from 28 to 35 percent.  Some pedons do not have an A&B horizon.
The A1 horizons have a hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 3 or 4, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 2 to 3.  Typically, it is a loam, but is a cobbly loam in some pedons.  It contains 0 to 10 percent gravel and 0 to 10 percent cobble.
The A2 horizon has a hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 6 or 7, 5 or 6 moist, and chroma of 2 through 4.  It is a very gravelly loam, very gravelly fine sandy loam or cobbly loam.  It contains 10 to 25 percent gravel, 10 to 15 percent cobble and 0 to 5 percent stones by volume.
The B2 horizon has a hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 5 or 6, 5 or 6 moist, and chroma of 4 through 6.  It is a very cobbly clay loam, or very stony clay loam.  It contains 20 to 35 percent gravel, 10 to 20 percent cobble, and 5 to 15 percent stones by volume.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Lucky Star, Nordic, (T)Norway Flat, and Schuster series.  The Lucky Star soils have a more acid soil reaction and redder hues in the Bt horizon.  Nordic soils are more acid in reaction, lack both A&B horizons, and B&A horizons, an have an A2 horizon that is 19 to 28 inches thick.  The (T)Norway Flat soils have less than 18 percent clay in the argillic horizon and have A&B horizons below a depth of 40 inches.  The Schuster soils have hues of 5YR or 2.5YR in the Bt horizon.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Dunckley soils are on mountainside slopes at elevations of 7,200 to 8,500 feet.  Slopes range from 25 to 65 percent.  These soils formed in colluvium derived from sandstone.  Mean annual temperature is 37 to 40 degrees F, and the mean summer temperature is 52 to 54 degrees F.  The mean annual precipitation is 18 to 22 inches.  The frost-free season is about 40 to 65 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Skylick, Skyway, Splitro, and Winevada soils.  Skylick soils are fine-loamy and have thicker mollic epipedons.  Skyway soils are coarse-loamy and have a thicker mollic epipedon with a lithic contact between a depth of 20 to 40 inches.  Splitro is shallow to a lithic contact.  Winevada soils have fine-loamy particle-size control sections, a thicker mollic epipedon, and have a lithic contact between a depth of 20 and 40 inches.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium or rapid runoff; moderate permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used for rangeland and livestock grazing and wildlife habitat.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Northwestern Colorado.  This series is of small extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Routt County Area, Colorado, 1981.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  Last updated by the state 8/81.
